poem:
Title: "Lament for Poco's Lemons"

Poco, old friend, do not close your doors,
Without one last dance with the lemon rinds.
Cellophane ghosts stripped away, bare and honest,
Your cucumbers took the stage, reinvented.
In this yellowed twilight, I'll sip your wisdom,
Savoring the tang of the end and beginning,
While Bristol's rain kisses the pavement,
A requiem for the restaurant that dared to dream.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
